result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher D. HARRISON

defendant.name: HARRISON, Christopher D.
defendant.address: 1709 20th Street Apt. A, Two Rivers, WI 54241

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Dismiss ordering count 1 of the action dismissed without prejudice because the defendant successfully completed the Deferred Judgment Agreement.

Count 1 - Battery (DVO) - No contest plea.   Court accepts defendant's plea, finds him guilty but defers entry of judgment of conviction pursuant to the Deferred Judgment Agreement.   Review  10-16-16.   
State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, disorderly conduct.   Motion granted.    
Waiver of Right to Attorney. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Minutes.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with District Attorney set for 09-25-15 at 3:00 p.m.  Plea date is set for 10-16-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher D. HARRISON

Prior: 3009 Lincoln Avenue / Highway 42 North, Room 108, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 08-17-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Notice.
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher D. HARRISON
Current: 3009 Lincoln Avenue / Highway 42 North, Room 108, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 07-24-2015)
Prior: 1709 20th Street, Apt. B, Two Rivers, WI 54241

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of substantial battery and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-10-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Cortney Stutleen.  Incidental contact due to living in the same building allowed, but mother of victim cannot be used as a go between.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
